content:
Sure, here are some example SQL commands to insert a minimum of 3 rows of data into each table:

Asset Table:
```sql
INSERT INTO Asset (AssetID, AssetType, AssetName, AssetDescription, PurchaseDate)
VALUES (1, 'Laptop', 'Dell XPS 13', 'Intel Core i7, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD', '2022-01-01'),
       (2, 'Monitor', 'Dell UltraSharp U2720Q', '27-inch 4K monitor', '2021-06-15'),
       (3, 'Printer', 'HP LaserJet Pro M404n', 'Black and white laser printer', '2021-09-30');
```
Financials Table:
```sql
INSERT INTO Financials (FinancialsID, AssetID, PurchaseCost, CurrentValue, DepreciationRate, DispositionDate)
VALUES (1, 1, 1500.00, 1200.00, 0.15, NULL),
       (2, 2, 700.00, 700.00, 0.10, NULL),
       (3, 3, 350.00, 300.00, 0.20, NULL);
```
Location Table:
```sql
INSERT INTO Location (LocationID, LocationName, Address, City, State, ZipCode)
VALUES (1, 'Headquarters', '123 Main St', 'Anytown', 'CA', '12345'),
       (2, 'Warehouse', '456 Elm St', 'Othertown', 'CA', '67890'),
       (3, 'Remote Office', '789 Oak St', 'Smalltown', 'NY', '23456');
```
Maintenance Table:
```sql
INSERT INTO Maintenance (MaintenanceID, AssetID, MaintenanceDate, MaintenanceType, MaintenanceDescription, MaintenanceCost)
VALUES (1, 1, '2022-02-15', 'Software Update', 'Installed latest operating system updates', 0),
       (2, 2, '2021-07-01', 'Cleaning', 'Dusted and wiped down monitor', 0),
       (3, 3, '2022-03-05', 'Toner Replacement', 'Replaced toner cartridge', 50.00);
```
Risk Table:
```sql
INSERT INTO Risk (RiskID, AssetID, RiskDescription, RiskProbability, RiskImpact)
VALUES (1, 1, 'Theft', 0.05, 500.00),
       (2, 2, 'Damage', 0.10, 700.00),
       (3, 3, 'Malfunction', 0.15, 200.00);
```
Compliance Table:
```sql
INSERT INTO Compliance (ComplianceID, AssetID, ComplianceDescription, ComplianceDate, ComplianceStatus)
VALUES (1, 1, 'Software License', '2022-01-01', 'Compliant'),
       (2, 2, 'OS Update', '2021-06-15', 'Compliant'),
       (3, 3, 'Security Audit', '2021-12-31', 'Non-Compliant');
```
These commands will insert a minimum of 3 rows of data into each table in the normalized asset management schema. Note that the data inserted is just for example purposes and is not representative of actual asset management data.
